Grumpy Gits SG

The monthly user group that doesn't lose your data!

Apr 8, 2015

The first git together is on!

It's Git's 10th anniversary, and we're having our first ever Git user meetup in Singapore! This meetup is aimed at both beginners and people who have over 10 years of Git experience (wait a minute). We hope to stretch your Gitability level, and better your understanding of version control systems!

Programme

  • A brief history of Git - Sahil Bajaj
  • Git for Teams - Sayanee Basu
  • Git Internals - Chow Loong Jin
  • Five random Git tips - ChernJie
  • The Crowd

Come merge with your fellow Gits!

Interested in speaking?

Please get in touch with Sahil, Valentine or ChernJie. We're looking for lightning talks!

Request for Presenters

Would you like to speak at an upcoming meetup? We're looking for speakers on -

  • How you got over the initial Git learning curve
  • Using Git to track data other than code
  • Your favorite but lesser-known Git utility
  • When to modify history for fun and profit
  • Your newest crazy idea using Git
  • How to stash effectively
  • Demystifying git rebase
  • Case studies of unique repos, e.g. the Linux kernel
  • Interesting Git workflows
  • How your community uses Git
  • Git CSI (archaeology/investigation)
  • GitHub alternatives
  • Git hooks

If you're interested in speaking, please get in touch on Gitter or Facebook chat!
